text: Electron micrograph of the ribonucleoprotein of mumps virus, which has a herring-bone like structure The rule of six is a feature of some paramyxovirus genomes. These RNA viruses have genes made from RNA and not DNA, and their whole genome – that is the number of nucleotides – is always a multiple of six. This is because during their replication, these viruses are dependent on nucleoprotein molecules that each bind to six nucleotides.. ==References== Category:Paramyxoviridae Category:Genetics
title: Rule of six (viruses)
